result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Gabriel Hall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Gabriel Hall in court.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Jonathan Gabriel Hall.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense has received most of discovery and requested final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court granted defense request.  Final pretrial documents to be filed by December 13, 2022.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 16; IN PERSON.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan Gabriel Hall in court with Attorney Michael F Torphy.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Patrick. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Gabriel Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant fail to appear. Court ordered a Stayed Bench Warrant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/8/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jonathan Gabriel Hall in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 053471,

Receipt Number: 22RP023075,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/06/2022@1p

Defendant Jonathan Gabriel Hall in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4/26/2022. Defendant was taken into custody. Initial appearance will be done in ICCR..
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/26/2022 @01:30pm
